snippet: An inquiry is now looking at activities in Brazil, China and India, along with Mexico, Wal-Mart said. Its quarterly results showed lower-than-expected sales.
abstract: Wal-Mart reports that its investigation into violations of Foreign Corrupt Practices Act has extended beyond Mexico to China, India and Brazil, suggesting retailer may have uncovered further evidence of potential violations; fallout continues from bribery scheme involving opening of a store in Mexico that was subject of New York Times investigation.

byline.original: By STEPHANIE CLIFFORD and DAVID BARSTOW
byline.contributor: Charlie Savage, Vikas Bajaj and Andrew Downie contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: An inquiry is now looking at activities in Brazil, China and India, along with Mexico, Wal-Mart said. Its quarterly results showed lower-than-expected sales.

headline.main: Wal-Mart Inquiry Reflects Alarm on Corruption
headline.print_headline: Wal-Mart Takes A Broader Look At Bribery Cases
